channel.title: Electro/House Supergroup - An Experiment
channel.description:
We all know the giant megacollabs we love doing, and we all know that some folks work well together. With that in mind, I’ve got a strange idea I’ve wanted to try out for some time:
An Auxy Electro/House supergroup (think Swedish House Mafia but... not SHM) consisting of at least three people and at most five or six, with the main project being a potential album or a simple EP. This is different from the megacollabs as it is one large project with a small number of people compared to one track with a large number of people.
I’m currently taking applications, and the applicants must meet the following credentials:
-Must have Auxy 6. -Must have an Auxy Pro subscription. (My apologies to those who don’t, this rule is just for a wider variety of sounds!) -Must know how Electro and House music works and how to produce it, as well as possible subgenres such as Melbourne Bounce, Progressive House and Progressive Electro (or Progresso!) -Must be willing to fully cooperate in this project. Goes without saying, you can’t just agree and then not do anything for it. (Even a freakin’ arp pluck would work, at least you’d be *adding* something.)
I would also like a demonstration of what you have done with Electro or House music. This way, I can evaluate if you’d actually fit in the project.
Deadline for applicants is 4/20 (nice), that’s the 20th of April, so that is one week from today. I will set up a Discord server in the meantime and invite the chosen members on that day.
Good luck to everyone, I’m hoping this turns out successfully!

item.title: Electro/House Supergroup - An Experiment
item.dc:creator: Maland2016
item.description:
A reminder that TOMORROW IS THE DEADLINE FOR APPLICANTS. If you want to join, NOW IS THE TIME TO SIGN UP!

Read full topic

item.title: Electro/House Supergroup - An Experiment
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
Already mentioned this to you on AC, but I can volunteer my time and experience with helping to manage and provide ideas, as well as finalizing tracks outside of Auxy once they are complete.

As for my experience, I‘ve managed/co-managed two of the AC Collaborations, Plains and Rush, as well as helped out with other collaborations in the past. I’ve also participated in the AC Megacollab Trick or treating with the spook gang, so I also have some experience with that.

I am both willing to provide this help as well as any leftover projects that may fill the bill, also the multitude of drum kits that I tend to use for my tracks as E/E, which range from Progressive House all the way to other styles entirely.

This seems like a nice opportunity, and any chance to work with Stigmo again would be awesome.

Read full topic

item.title: Electro/House Supergroup - An Experiment
item.dc:creator: Stigmo
item.description:
This is right up my alley, so obviously I’m interested.

Here are some examples of what kind of music I make:

https://soundcloud.com/stigmomusic/tundra
https://soundcloud.com/stigmomusic/sky-high

A sidenote: As I do not know how the coming months will unfold for me, I cannot guarantee that I will be able to contribute. This means that I might withdraw my application for this collab project. I’m interested in it nonetheless.

Read full topic

item.title: Electro/House Supergroup - An Experiment
item.dc:creator: Octave
item.description:
This sounds like my sort of thing. I would describe my music to be mostly Melodic House.
https://soundcloud.com/octave-72811140/eradicate#t=1:18
https://soundcloud.com/octave-72811140/infusion#t=0:42 (Track of the Week winner)
https://soundcloud.com/octave-72811140/instinct#t=0:56

Read full topic
